org.divxdede.swing.busy
Interface BusyIcon

All Superinterfaces:
Icon
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBusyIcon, DecoratorBusyIcon, DefaultBusyIcon, InfiniteBusyIcon, RadialBusyIcon
public interface BusyIcon
extends Icon

BusyIcon are simple icons with Busy renderable capabilities.

Such icons draw a animations related to the current state of the underlying BoundedRangeModel.
A BusyIcon can be bound to a basic BoundedRangeModel or to a more featured BusyModel.

When a BusyIcon is bound to a BusyModel, this icon can render undeterminable state or idle state (not busy).
Otherwise, if an icon is bound to a simple BoundedRangeModel, this icon will be always considered in a determinate state.

This interface don't provide any contract on how a BusyIcon should fire an event to the graphical interface when it need to be repainted (when the model or state change).
But we strong recommand to support the Observable class for the best integration inside BusyLayerUI.

Since:
1.1
Author:
André Sébastien (divxdede)

Method Detail

setModel

void setModel(BoundedRangeModel model)
Define the BoundedRangeModel used for render this icon progression.

If the BoundedRangeModel is a BusyModel, this icon will use attributes like BusyModel.isBusy() and BusyModel.isDeterminate() for render this icon.

Parameters:
model - BoundedRangeModel to bound to this icon (can be null)

getModel

BoundedRangeModel getModel()
Return the current BoundedRangeModel used for render this icon progression.

If the BoundedRangeModel is a BusyModel, this icon will use attributes like BusyModel.isBusy() and BusyModel.isDeterminate() for render this icon.

Returns:
The underlying BoundedRangeModel (may be null)

isDeterminate

boolean isDeterminate()
Returns true if this icon currently render a determinate state
Some implementation of BusyIcon don't support to render a determinate state whatever the current state of the underlying Model.
In theses cases, this method should indicate that this icon render an undeterminate state even if the BusyModel is on an determinate state.

If this icon can render all states (undeterminate,determinate), this method should be in sync with the underlying model.
In the other case, this asynchronous state can be used by BusyLayerUI to determine if they need to add some externals informations (exemple a Progress Bar) in addition of the icon for track the progression advance of the BusyModel.

Returns:
true if this icon currently render a determinate state
